message: I wake with a splitting headache.
Did I... black out?
Even after I open my eyes, I can't make out anything in the darkness.
Somewhere, I hear the rhythmic drip, drip, drip of water. Is it raining?
The cold surface against my cheek must be a concrete floor.
Where am I...?
I try to stand up, but my body won't move.
My arms are tied behind my back. I struggle, but the bonds hold firm.

When I manage to lift my head off the ground...<K>
I come face to face with a pair of boots.
I slowly drag my gaze upward from there.
It's him. The guy who waltzed into my home and knocked me out.
Up close, he's even more intimidating than before.
As I watch, the man takes a puff from his pipe. The smoke disperses into the gloomy air.
That's right. I remember now.
He took Granny!

name: 蒼葉
message: "...Where's Granny?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "What did you do with her? Answer me!"
I struggle to contain my rage.
The man just stares at me in silence for a while. Then, finally, he rises with a creaking of springs.
Before I know what's happening, he crouches down and yanks my head up by a clump of my bangs.

name: 蒼葉
message: "Ngh! Ow...!"
My face twists in agony as pain runs through my sensitive hair.
He stares at me as I squirm.
His eyes are pitch black, like two spots devoid of light.

name: ミンク
message: "Do you understand your position?"
He tugs my face to the side.
Two grungy looking men are standing there, holding submachine guns.

name: ミンク
message: "I just have to raise my hand, and you can kiss your ass goodbye."
I guess he takes my silence as understanding, because he lets go of my hair.
My chin hits the concrete with a loud thunk. I nearly bite my tongue.
Damn... I'm in some seriously deep shit...

name: ミンク
message: "Hey."
The man calls his men over and whispers something to them. They nod and leave the room.
Meanwhile, I search my brain for a plan. I have to get out of here.
First, to do something about these restraints...
I struggle against my bonds. I can feel them loosen slightly, but they aren't coming off.
I poke around with the toes of my shoes, thinking there might be something by my feet I could use.
But all I feel is floor. There's nothing.
Shit. I have to do something...
